name: Pick dual-write FPs even if user provided config exists
body: Allow setting of dual-write FPs if any user config is provided

name: Allow DynoJedisClient to set its own consistency level
Allow DynoJedisClient to set up a datastore connection
DynoLock release
body:
- DynoLock
- Fix in DualWriter for Demo

name: Use IPAddresses from HostSupplier rather than from AbstractTokenMapSupplier
Backport fixes to v1.6.5
body:
Included with this release:
- DynoLock
- Datastore aware connections
- Jedis version remains at 2.9.0
- Immediate connection recycling for bad connections
- Miscellaneous bug fixes

name: Fix demo properties from affecting client
body:
- Fix demo properties from affecting client
- Avoid NPE without information in refreshHosts()
- Make Travis CI use OpenJDK 8 instead of OracleJDK 8
- Fix dual writes in DynoJedisDemo

name: Adding fix for host selection fallback using localrack
v1.6.6-rc.3
body: Expire hash fixes

name: v1.6.6-rc.2
body:
- Upgrade to Jedis 3.0.0
- New Dyno Json Recipe supporting ReJson Redis module
- Support SCRIPT LOAD and EVALSHA in Dyno
- Bug fixes in pipelines and expire hash

name: v1.6.6-rc.1
body: Expire Hash - Redis hash with timeout on hash fields.

name: v1.6.5
body:
* Debug logging to display hosts that went up/down
* Redis authentication support

name: Support Pipeline operations from Dual Writer Dyno Client
body:
* Support Pipeline operations from Dual Writer Dyno Client
* Fix infinite recursive calls in Jedis' pipelines 
* Expand Dyno Jedis Demo to test Dual Writer Dyno Client

name: Circular List thread safety bug fix
Multi operations binary support & Dyno module
Fix Null Pointer Exception in MGET
body: We were trying to read binary keys even when they were not specified, causing a null pointer exception in mget operations.

name: Leak in compression & Unify Host objects
body:
There has been a leak in the zlip.inflate that can lead to out of memory. Every read that needs to uncompress leaks memory, and failed compress attempts also may leak.

Also, the final host object given to ConnectionPool should be a union of information cherrypicked from host supplier and token map supplier. This version fixes these issues.

name: Use Hosts from Token Map Supplier
body: Previously we were using hosts from the HostSupplier, which may or may not have a valid port in it, to prime connections. In this release, for every host from HostSupplier, we map the corresponding host from TokenMapSupplier, which has all the port information etc and use that to prime connections.

name: EVAL and Error on Token supplier
body:
* Additional Sorted Set command
* Support for EVAL
* Update on Archaius and Eureka dependencies
* Logging error if there is an issue contacting the token supplier

name: Hashtags
body: * Moved the Hashtag configuration to the connection pool.

name: SET with expire, dyno_scan fix move to EurekaClient
body:
* use EurekaClient instead of DiscoveryClient
* adding support for `String set(String key, String value, String nxxx`...
* ConsulHostSupplier
* `dyno_scan` fix

name: Support for mget
body:
Added basic support for mget to get a list of keys from dynomite in a single redis call.
This is better for performance since Dyno;s pipeline implementation is restricted to a single key

name: Fixing dyno_scan
body:
* Fixing  `dyno_scan` in multiple nodes per AZ case. Improving potential performance for other cases
* Updating `dynoJedisDemo` to be able to talk to both TEST and PROD through Discovery

name: Do not use Port for Host comparison
body:
The previous fix for moving to compareTo broke the change where we did not use port for host comparison.
Fix It!

name: Connection Piling fixes
body: This release fixes a bunch of issues recently occured due to the changes in the comparator contract for Host object.

name: Fix Client Connections piling up
body:
There are cases where the ip address from token map supplier and host supplier could be different especially in environments like AWS where there could be different private and public ip address. Hence ip address is not a very reliable way to compare hosts.  This lead to client constantly trying to make new connections to the dynomite cluster and hence piling up.

We now use host names and rack to compare and match the hosts. And this issue is resolved

name: Port fix
body: Dyno can use any port.

name: Bug on host object
body: Details can be found in: https://github.com/Netflix/dyno/pull/153

name: Gradle 3.1 and NetflixOSS 3.5.1
body: This release updates the Gradle and NetflixOSS

name: ZADD with more parameters
body: - `zadd` with parameters to support `xx`, `nx` and `ch` params by @v1r3n

name: Added Features stable
body:
This release stabilizes the new features:
- Dual writes
- cross-zone fallback
- Private IP address support

name: Dyno secure in VPC
body:
- Limits Dyno to obtain and keep track of tokens only for nodes in each local datacenter. It addresses a security issue of making HTTP calls for Dynomite-manager tokens across regions. The only negative implication is when we use the JMX getTopologySnapshot we will only see same Datacenter tokens. Hence, we need to check client nodes in all regions to make sure the token distribution is correct.
- Fixes the bug that the HostToken received from the JSON does not contain a private IP address, hence a node could not be added in the Host connection pool.
- Added extra reliability in the way we perform requests for the cluster_describe. Before it would try one node and if it failed it would propagate the exception to the connection pool. Now it tries multiple nodes (twice by default) and propagates the last node to the connection pool.
- Dual writes
- Fixing some white spaces and some Java convention.

name: Dual Writes
body:
Release candidate includes:
- Favoring private ip address usage over public hostnames if available
- Dual Write functionality (see corresponding Wiki page for details)

name: Cross-rack fallback
body: Details in [this commit](https://github.com/Netflix/dyno/commit/b2a9520d80fcf06ad777d4097843e82bd92bfca2)

Bug fixes that address the following:
1. If the local zone is not known the client was throwing an NPE while inferring the replication factor from the topology
2. If a miss occurs while reading a key and compression is enabled an NPE will be thrown

name: Minor bug fixes
body: Minor fixes related to compression and zone aware configuration. See commits for details.
